justification: The article notes, “The Iowa Gambling Task (IGT… ) is a commonly used behavioural measure of risky decision-making,” explicitly identifying the IGT as the instrument for this construct.
Under Materials and Methods the authors state, “We used the modified IGT (52) and CGT (34) to assess risky decision-making,” indicating the CGT also serves as a measure of risky decision-making.

The Measures section reports, “We assessed self-injurious behaviours with the… Self-Injurious Thoughts and Behaviours Interview-Revised (SITBI-R; 70),” linking the SITBI-R to assessment of self-injurious behaviours.

The authors explain, “We assessed recent depression symptoms with items from the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS)… Depression Short Form 6a,” specifying this scale as the depression measure.
It is stated, “We assessed trait self-criticism with the Self-Rating Scale (SRS; 73),” identifying the SRS as the instrument for trait self-criticism.
The paper notes, “We assessed trait impulsivity with the Short UPPS-P Impulsive Behaviour Scale (S-UPPS-P; 77),” indicating this scale measures trait impulsivity.

measured_by: Acquired Capability for Suicide Scale – Fearlessness About Death (ACSS-FAD)
justification: During recruitment the study screened for “elevated scores on… the Acquired Capability for Suicide Scale-Fearlessness About Death,” showing this scale measures the construct of fearlessness about death.

measured_by: Reasons for Living Inventory – Fear of Suicide scale
justification: The authors list “the Reasons for Living Inventory-Fear of Suicide scale (63)” as one of the measures used for screening, indicating it operationalizes fear of suicide.
Eligibility screening included “the Painful and Provocative Events Scale-Revised,” linking this instrument to the construct of exposure to painful and provocative events.
construct: Exposure to painful and provocative events
